overall_perception_summary.headline: The Clinical Relief Architect
overall_perception_summary.description: Dr. Althea bypasses the beauty counter to set up shop directly in the laboratory. By coding its identity through the '345' numerical system and stark pharmaceutical aesthetics, it positions itself not as a cosmetic option but as a medical necessity for compromised skin. It offers the relief of a prescription with the accessibility of a daily moisturizer.

foundation.title: The Safe Healer
foundation.description: The brand grounds its authority in a Clinical Origin, using the 'Dr.' moniker and institutional seals to promise Restoration for damaged skin. It adheres to a Safety First value system, sacrificing aggressive potency for guaranteed tolerance on sensitive faces. The positioning is The Medical Authority—a utility-focused product that feels like it belongs in a first-aid kit rather than a vanity case.

identity.title: The Stoic Pharmacist
identity.description: The relationship is defined by The Reliable Expert—distant, competent, and focused entirely on the problem. Driven by the Caregiver archetype (60%), it uses a Pharma-Code visual identity of stark whites and data grids to signal safety. The Tone of Voice is Clinical Authority—dry, precise, and devoid of humor.

communication.title: Data-Driven Recovery
communication.description: The messaging is The Problem Solver, hooking the user with the promise of 'Relief' and proving it with Rational data ('177% boost'). The USP is The Specialist, targeting the specific niche of post-acne recovery with its '345' complex. The focus is Science Education, using the PDP to teach the user about barrier repair mechanisms.

benefits.title: Barrier Restoration
benefits.description: Functionally, the product is a Restorer, designed to fix broken barriers and soothe irritation. The Emotional Benefit is Relief/Safety—the absence of pain and anxiety about breakouts. Socially, it is The Pragmatist's choice—a logical tool for those who prioritize results over trends.

marker_1.slider_a_label: [SLIDER] ORIGIN OF AUTHORITY (The Source of Power)
marker_1.reasoning: The brand name 'Dr. Althea' and the prominent 'Korea Institute of Dermatological Sciences' seal anchor the authority firmly in the clinic (Origin: 2/5 Derm-Validated), despite the use of natural ingredients like Tea Tree. The mission is explicit: 'Relief,' 'Post-acne recovery,' and soothing 'Blemish' issues. This is not about enhancement; it is about fixing a pathology (Mission: 2/5 Restoration).
marker_1.evidence: Dr. Althea... Korea Institute of Dermatological Sciences... Post-acne recovery... Blemish care... Relief Cream

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Slider A (2/5 Clinical) + Slider B (2/5 Restoration) match typical pattern for Territory 1 - The Healer. Clinical origin + restoration goal aligns with correction-focused content.

marker_2.slider_b_position_name: ▼ Approachable (Easy to find, easy to buy)
marker_2.reasoning: The scope is laser-focused on a specific problem: 'Post-acne marks' and 'Sensitive skin.' It isn't trying to change the world; it's trying to fix your face (Scope: 1/5 Micro-Correction). However, the format (tube), the platform (Amazon), and the presentation ('all-in-one') make this highly accessible to the average sufferer (Access: 4/5 Approachable).
marker_2.evidence: Post-acne marks... Sensitive and acne-prone skin... all-in-one formula... lightweight

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Slider A (1/5 Micro-Correction) + Slider B (4/5 Approachable) match typical pattern for Territory 1 - The Democratizers. Focused correction scope + accessible barriers aligns with democratic health content.

marker_3.reasoning: The copy repeatedly emphasizes 'Soothing,' 'Calming,' and 'Sensitive skin suitability.' Even though it targets acne, it prioritizes not irritating the user over aggressive 'burning' actives (Performance: 2/5 Gentle). They back this up with dense data: 'Clinical Trial Completed,' ingredient breakdowns, and the '345' philosophy (Transparency: 2/5 Evidence-First).
marker_3.evidence: Skin Irritation Tested For Sensitive Skin... Soothing protection... 3-4-5 ingredient philosophy... Transparent ingredient listing

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Slider A (2/5 Gentle) + Slider B (2/5 Evidence-First) match typical pattern for Territory 1 - Safety First. Gentle priority + data transparency aligns with safe harbor content.

marker_4.reasoning: The visual language is 'Stark black on white' with 'Clinical-style tube format.' It looks like something a doctor hands you, not something you buy for a vanity shelfie (Aesthetic: 2/5 Professional). The 'Daily routine' messaging and practical tube packaging position it as a reliable utility item (Value: 2/5 Daily Essential).
marker_4.evidence: Stark black on white... Clinical-style tube format... Squeeze tube packaging with industrial crimp details... daily routines

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Slider A (2/5 Professional) + Slider B (2/5 Daily Essential) match typical pattern for Territory 1 - The Medical Authority. Clinical aesthetic + utility value aligns with pharmacy positioning.

marker_5.reasoning: The brand speaks through seals, numbers ('345'), and clinical claims. There is very little emotional warmth or 'friendliness'—it's polite but distant (Warmth: 2/5 Distant). The authority is high: 'Dr. Althea,' 'Institute,' 'Clinically Validated.' It positions itself as the expert in the room (Authority: 4/5 Specialist).
marker_5.evidence: Dr. Althea... Korea Institute of Dermatological Sciences... Clinically validated... 345 Relief Cream

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Slider A (2/5 Distant) + Slider B (4/5 Specialist) match typical pattern for Territory 3 - The Reliable Expert. Low warmth + high authority aligns with competence-focused personality.

marker_6.reasoning: The primary drive is Protection and Relief—'Soothing,' 'Calming,' 'Safe for sensitive skin' (Caregiver: 60%). This is supported by a Sage layer of radical transparency—'3-4-5 ingredient philosophy' and detailed clinical data (Sage: 30%). A small Innocent streak appears via 'Vegan' and 'Clean' claims, but the dominant energy is the reassuring, protective hand of the doctor.
marker_6.evidence: Relief Cream... Soothing protection... Skin Irritation Tested... Transparent ingredient listing... Vegan... Clean and ethical

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Marker 6 uses percentage distribution. Dominance of Caregiver (Stability/Control) places this in Territory 4.

marker_7.reasoning: The text is purely informational. 'Clinically validated,' 'Provides immediate skin soothing,' 'Non-comedogenic.' There are no jokes, no exclamation marks, and no slang. It sounds like a diagnosis or a lab report, prioritizing precision over entertainment.
marker_7.evidence: Clinically validated... Suitability for Acne-prone Skin... Provides a massive 177% immediate boost... 3-4-5 ingredient philosophy

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Humor (1/5) + Enthusiasm (2/5) + Formality (2/5) matches the hard rule for Territory 1 - The Clinical Authority. The signals are academic, dry, and fact-based.

marker_8.reasoning: The palette is 'Stark black on white' with accents of 'Clinical Green.' The layout is highly structured—grids of text, vertical columns of ingredients, and rigid infographics. It signals control, hygiene, and scientific precision (Pharma-Code).
marker_8.evidence: Stark black on white... Linear grid... Vertical ingredient breakdown... Dashed border around clinical data... Pale sage green
marker_8.look_and_feel: A stark, high-contrast apothecary aesthetic that uses negative space and rigid typography to communicate medical-grade purity.
marker_8.distinctive_asset_3: Korea Institute of Dermatological Sciences Seal
marker_8.primary_palette: Clinical white and black base with accents of medicinal sage green and pale yellow.

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Slider A (2/5 Cool) + Slider B (1/5 Swiss Grid) match typical pattern for Territory 1 - Pharma-Code. Cool temperature + rigid structure aligns with sterile visual content.

marker_9.reasoning: The brand hooks with the result: 'Relief,' 'Post-acne recovery,' 'Soothing.' It's about fixing a problem (Hook: 4/5 Result). The persuasion is purely logical: '177% hydration boost,' 'Clinical Trial Completed,' 'Non-comedogenic.' It convinces the brain, not the heart (Persuasion: 2/5 Rational).
marker_9.evidence: Relief Cream... Post-acne recovery... 177% immediate boost... Clinical Trial Completed... Non-comedogenic

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Slider A (4/5 Result) + Slider B (2/5 Rational) match typical pattern for Territory 2 - The Problem Solver. Result-focused hook + rational persuasion aligns with functional messaging.

marker_10.reasoning: The 'Dr. Althea' name suggests a professional protagonist, but the lack of a specific founder story keeps it institutional (Protagonist: 2/5 Professional). The setting is unequivocally the lab: 'Korea Institute,' 'Clinical Trial,' 'Dermatologist-inspired.' The story is about science solving a problem (Setting: 1/5 Sterile).
marker_10.evidence: Dr. Althea... Korea Institute of Dermatological Sciences... Clinical Trial... Dermatologist-inspired

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Slider A (2/5 Professional) + Slider B (1/5 Sterile) match typical pattern for Territory 1 - The Lab Breakthrough. Professional protagonist + sterile setting aligns with intellectual origin content.

marker_11.reasoning: Validation comes directly from 'The Board'—specifically the 'Korea Institute of Dermatological Sciences' and 'Dermatologist Tested' seals. The proof is quantitative: '177% boost,' 'Irritation Tested,' 'Non-comedogenic TESTED.' It relies on the authority of the white coat and the chart.
marker_11.evidence: Korea Institute of Dermatological Sciences... Dermatologist Tested... 177% immediate boost... Non-comedogenic TESTED

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Slider A (1/5 Board) + Slider B (1/5 Graph) match typical pattern for Territory 1 - Derm-Validation. Expert validation + clinical data proof aligns with expertise-focused content.

marker_12.slider_a_label: [SLIDER] THE OWNERSHIP CLAIM (What Makes You Unique)
marker_12.slider_b_label: [SLIDER] THE TARGET SCOPE (How Wide Is The Net?)
marker_12.slider_b_position_name: ▼ The Problem Solver (Targets specific skin concern)
marker_12.reasoning: The brand attempts to own the '345' concept—a specific numeric philosophy/ratio that acts as a proprietary complex (Ownership: 3/5). The scope is narrowed to a specific condition set: 'Post-acne marks,' 'Blemish,' and 'Sensitive skin.' It is not a general moisturizer; it is a specialist tool for recovery (Scope: 4/5 Specialist).
marker_12.evidence: 345 Relief Cream... 3-4-5 ingredient philosophy... Post-acne marks... Blemish... Sensitive and acne-prone skin

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Slider A (3/5 Complex) + Slider B (4/5 Problem Solver) match typical pattern for Territory 4 - The Specialist. Proprietary complex ownership + problem-specific scope aligns with diagnostic USP content.

marker_13.reasoning: The content is heavy on education: detailed infographics, ingredient breakdowns ('Tea Tree,' 'Ceramide NP'), and 'How it Works' visuals (Depth: 2/5 Explainer). The intent is to prove the thesis of safety and efficacy through 'Clinical Trial' badges and testing claims (Intent: 1/5 The Thesis).
marker_13.evidence: Ingredient Focus infographic... Clinical Trial Completed... How it works graphics... Tea Tree Leaf Water... Ceramide NP

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Slider A (2/5 Explainer) + Slider B (1/5 Thesis) match typical pattern for Territory 1 - Science Education. Education depth + proof intent aligns with mechanism-focused content.

marker_14.reasoning: The product is defined by its action: 'Relief,' 'Soothing,' 'Calming.' It is a Healer for irritated skin (Action: 4/5). The outcome is restoring a healthy, comfortable state—'relief from skin dullness,' 'hydrating'—rather than creating an artificial aesthetic perfection (Outcome: 2/5 Sensory/Health).
marker_14.evidence: Relief Cream... Soothing protection... Calming... Post-acne recovery... relief from skin dullness

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Slider A (4/5 Healer) + Slider B (2/5 Sensory) match typical pattern for Territory 1 - Restoration. Healing mechanism + health outcome aligns with recovery-focused functional content.

marker_15.slider_a_position_name: ▼ Panic Mode (Urgent need to stop pain/itch)
marker_15.slider_b_position_name: ▼ Sanctuary (I feel safe inside my own body)
marker_15.reasoning: For a customer with 'Acne-prone' or 'Sensitive' skin, the primary emotion is anxiety. This product offers 'Relief' and 'Safety' (Anxiety: 1/5 Panic/Relief). It allows the user to feel safe in their own skin again, removing the threat of irritation (Self-Perception: 1/5 Sanctuary).
marker_15.evidence: Relief Cream... Sensitive and acne-prone skin... Skin Irritation Tested... Soothing

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Slider A (1/5 Relief) + Slider B (1/5 Sanctuary) match typical pattern for Territory 1 - Relief / Safety. High relief focus + internal sanctuary aligns with calm-focused emotional content.

marker_16.slider_a_position_name: ▼ The Tool (I buy it only because it functions)
marker_16.slider_b_position_name: ▼ The Standard (What everyone uses; the default)
marker_16.reasoning: There is almost zero lifestyle signaling here. No 'aesthetic' shelfie vibes, no status claims. It is a 'Relief Cream' purchased because it functions. It's a Tool (1/5). The tribal orientation is towards 'The Standard'—a pragmatic solution for a common problem (Acne) rather than a niche club.
marker_16.evidence: Relief Cream... Clinical Trial Completed... Post-acne marks... Functional packaging

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Slider A (1/5 Tool) + Slider B (1/5 Standard) match typical pattern for Territory 1 - The Pragmatist. Functional driver + mass orientation aligns with rational self-expression content.

marker_17.slider_a_position_name: ▼ Normalization (I want to look like everyone else)
marker_17.reasoning: The goal of treating acne/sensitivity is often Normalization—returning to a baseline where you don't stand out for your skin issues (Vector: 1/5). The brand appeals to the broad population of sufferers ('Acne-prone skin') rather than a distinct tribe, offering a Safe Choice backed by data.
marker_17.evidence: Suitability for Acne-prone Skin... Sensitive skin... Normalization of skin condition... Clinical badges

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Slider A (1/5 Normalization) + Slider B (1/5 Majority) match typical pattern for Territory 1 - The Safe Choice. Normalization goal + majority dynamic aligns with belonging-focused social content.
